<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/snap-soars-social-media-evolves-new-era-creators-commerce?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No, Snap Didn't Ghost Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/snap-soars-social-media-evolves-new-era-creators-commerce?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Snapchat ghost all swagged out" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTAwL3NuYXBjaGF0X2dob3N0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Snap is TikTok’s older cousin who just came back from living abroad for a couple years and now looks...pretty hot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The social media company’s stock catapulted <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/23/snap-stock-soars-more-than-23percent-day-after-earnings-beat.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 24%</a> after reporting its biggest growth quarter in four years Thursday. Daily active users climbed to 293 million in the second quarter, up 23% annually. Revenue more than doubled to $982 million, which was way above analysts’ estimates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In short, it’s “hard to see anything that’s not firing on all cylinders,” Bernstein tech analyst Mark Shmulik said.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s working? </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lockdowns ending: </strong></span><span>Posting on Snap is way more fun when you can travel and brag about it to your friends. In a previous earnings report, CEO Evan Spiegel said that easing Covid restrictions boosted Story posting and engagement with Snap Map.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Digital ad boom: </strong></span><span>Snap’s improvements to its ad offerings and higher digital ad spending overall means brands are willing to pay more for a placement with Snap. That’s translated into mega revenue growth.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">No poison from Apple: </strong></span><span>Snap said that the rollout of Apple’s iOS 14.5 privacy update did not impact it as much as expected.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">They’re going through changes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Social media companies are evolving as they transition from youth to middle-age. Snap has invested heavily in augmented reality and commerce—it wants you to shop online and “try on” clothing using its AR technology. Twitter, which also reported a stellar quarter Thursday, has introduced live audio, newsletters, and tip jars. Facebook’s goal is to become a “metaverse company,” which we’re not even sure Zuck knows the meaning of but we’ll be eager observers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Platforms are also responding to the emerging power of “creators” to pull in users, exemplified by the success of TikTok. At one point Snap was doling out $1 million per day to creators on its TikTok-clone Spotlight, and Facebook is paying $1 billion to creators through 2022.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F23%2Fsnap-soars-social-media-evolves-new-era-creators-commerce" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/tokyo-olympics-holds-surreal-opening-ceremony?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hajimemashite, Tokyo Olympics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Photos from the Opening Ceremony" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q53yLdCf8bmxymyKdy/giphy.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Photos from the Opening Ceremony" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q53yLdCf8bmxymyKdy/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wally Skalij /Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A song from the video game <em>Final Fantasy</em> blares over the speakers to a mostly empty stadium as masked Olympic athletes parade around the track. Meanwhile, a small group of protestors outside can <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/sports/anti-olympics-protests-opening-cermonies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">be heard</a> chanting, “No to the Olympics!” and “Save people’s lives!” in reference to the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic. You look up and 1,800 drones form a spinning orb, visible throughout Tokyo—which is currently in a state of emergency due to a rise in coronavirus cases...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/31869095/olympics-opening-ceremony-highlight-good-bad-tokyo-games?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">That was the scene</a> at the Opening Ceremony for the Tokyo Olympics yesterday. Here are a few other standout moments:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Japanese tennis star Naomi Osaka lit the Olympic cauldron.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A Kabuki performer cleansed the stadium’s negative energy with traditional dance while Hiromi Uehara made everyone wish they could play piano. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Keith Urban, John Legend, and other singers from across the globe sang “Imagine” together, because we learned nothing from Gal Gadot’s version.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now comes the fun part: </strong><a href="https://www.nbcolympics.com/schedule?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here’s the master TV schedule</a> for the athletic competitions.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BEVERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/boston-beer-maker-truly-hard-seltzer-says-hard-seltzer-party?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Bubbles of Bubbles Has Finally Popped
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Truly seltzer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81ODk4L3RydWx5X3NlbHR6ZXIuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Truly</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We should’ve known when our mom texted us asking if we’d had the “white claw drink,” but hard seltzer is no longer the golden child of alcoholic beverages. Shares in Boston Beer, the company that makes Truly hard seltzer, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/23/boston-beer-stock-tumbles-21percent-after-weak-truly-hard-seltzer-sales-weigh-on-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collapsed</a> 27% yesterday after it warned the seltzer party was over.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hard seltzer was a fast-growing segment that reached <a href="https://thingtesting.com/stories/brands-winning-hard-seltzer-wars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$4.5 billion in global sales</a> in 2020. But whether beer has made a comeback or people are just drinking less overall, Boston Beer said it “overestimated” the growth of hard seltzer in Q2 and said the future was “uncertain.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Founder Jim Koch blamed the miss on a maturing market and customer confusion, given all the options. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>We blame </span><span><a href="https://trulyhardseltzer.com/punch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Truly Punch</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> More than 150 brands are all competing to be your lake day drink, and the industry’s realizing that’s probably too many. Just a few weeks ago, Coors said it would be discontinuing its Coors Seltzer...so it can devote more resources to its <em>other </em>seltzer products.</p>

Here, let <a href="https://twitter.com/Indians/status/1418565355472101378?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tom Hanks</a> tell you all about it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I want to be the biggest podcast in the world.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Call Her Daddy</em> host Alex Cooper was the most popular person on the internet Thursday, with profiles in the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/call-her-daddy-host-alex-cooper-wants-to-have-the-biggest-podcast-in-the-world-11626871648?mod=e2tw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a>, <a href="https://time.com/6082311/call-her-daddy-alexandra-cooper/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Time</a>, <a href="https://www.bustle.com/politics/alex-cooper-call-her-daddy-spotify-deal-breakup?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bustle</a>, and <a href="https://www.refinery29.com/en-us/2021/07/10585125/alex-cooper-call-her-daddy-interview-spotify-sex-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Refinery29</a>. Cooper’s podcast became exclusive to Spotify this week after she signed a $60 million contract with the streamer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The resurgent appeal of Guinness world records. (<a href="https://www.theringer.com/pop-culture/2021/7/20/22579991/guinness-world-records-2020-zaila-avant-garde?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Ringer</a>)</p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSnap is TikTok’s older cousin who just came back from living abroad for a couple years and now looks...pretty hot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe social media company’s stock catapulted \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/23/snap-stock-soars-more-than-23percent-day-after-earnings-beat.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly 24%\u003c/a\u003e after reporting its biggest growth quarter in four years Thursday. Daily active users climbed to 293 million in the second quarter, up 23% annually. Revenue more than doubled to $982 million, which was way above analysts’ estimates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn short, it’s “hard to see anything that’s not firing on all cylinders,” Bernstein tech analyst Mark Shmulik said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s working? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLockdowns ending: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePosting on Snap is way more fun when you can travel and brag about it to your friends. In a previous earnings report, CEO Evan Spiegel said that easing Covid restrictions boosted Story posting and engagement with Snap Map.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDigital ad boom: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSnap’s improvements to its ad offerings and higher digital ad spending overall means brands are willing to pay more for a placement with Snap. That’s translated into mega revenue growth.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo poison from Apple: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSnap said that the rollout of Apple’s iOS 14.5 privacy update did not impact it as much as expected.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThey’re going through changes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSocial media companies are evolving as they transition from youth to middle-age. Snap has invested heavily in augmented reality and commerce—it wants you to shop online and “try on” clothing using its AR technology. Twitter, which also reported a stellar quarter Thursday, has introduced live audio, newsletters, and tip jars. Facebook’s goal is to become a “metaverse company,” which we’re not even sure Zuck knows the meaning of but we’ll be eager observers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlatforms are also responding to the emerging power of “creators” to pull in users, exemplified by the success of TikTok. At one point Snap was doling out $1 million per day to creators on its TikTok-clone Spotlight, and Facebook is paying $1 billion to creators through 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
